text:
(1) Emmons Ave., north side, west of East 27th Street, showing "Judge Tappan's Roadhouse" in the foreground.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a closer view.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) Emmons Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 27th Street, showing the Tappan's Hotel from 1860-1873. It was conducted as a restaurant by Stephen and Gaskin in 1922. It ceased to be a restaurant in 1933, when Mr. Stephen boarded up the place.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing a front view.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, another view.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing also the outbuildings. This hotel was started by Jeremiah Tappan in 1845, and was prominent in the horse racing days as 'Judge Tappen's Roadhouse'. George C. Tappan, the son of Jeremiah was the owner until his death.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

2765-2761 E. 27th Street, east side, between Emmons and Vorhies Avenues, showing two cottages still in existence in Sheepshead Bay.

About 1928.

Gift of V.J. Yannaccone

(1) Emmons Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 27th Street. This is the former Tappens Hotel, known as an eating place, throughout the United States. It closed its doors in 1933 and has not reopened.

July 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing the other buildings connected with the Hotel.

July 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from another angle.

July 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

Notwithstanding modern times; Sheepshead Bay has its traveling merchant of hardware. Scene taken at Emmons Ave., and East 27th Street, Brooklyn.

July 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Hardware - [Brooklyn].

text:
Sheepshead Bay (Brooklyn): West across new dock construction off Emmons Avenue, seen from East 27th Street. On the extreme right (views 1,2) is the Lewis House, about a century old. Views 2 and 3 show the East 27th Street beach.

Views 1,2: July 9, 1936
View 3: August 14, 1937

P. L. Sperr

A2 Negative # 3942
A3 Negative # 3940
title: Sheepshead Bay - Brooklyn.
